headline: Paycom, AppLovin, Braze, Salesforce, and Elastic Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after investor fears over artificial intelligence disrupting the software industry sparked a broad sell-off. The anxiety stemmed from the rapid adoption of new 'agentic AI' tools, which some investors believed could dismantle traditional Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) business models. This 'AI Panic' led to indiscriminate selling across the sector. The market move reflected growing concerns about the downside of the AI boom for established software

headline: Salesforce AI Push With Asymbl And Layoffs Meets Depressed Valuation
summary: Salesforce and Asymbl have expanded their partnership to build AI powered platforms that coordinate hybrid workforces of human employees and digital agents. The move is part of Salesforce's broader push to integrate digital labor into enterprise workflows and rethink how tasks are allocated across teams. Alongside this, Salesforce has recently carried out layoffs that it has linked to AI driven changes in how it runs its operations. For investors watching NYSE:CRM, these announcements come...

headline: Salesforce (Informatica) Named a Leader in the 2026 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Augmented Data Quality Solutions for the 18th Time
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., February 17, 2026--Informatica from Salesforce, a leader in enterprise AI-powered cloud data management, today announced that it has been recognized once again as a Leader in the 2026 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Augmented Data Quality Solutions. This marks the 18th time Informatica has been positioned in the Leaders Quadrant, reflecting the company’s recognition for both "Ability to Execute" and "Completeness of Vision."

This marks the 18th time Informatica has been positioned in the Leaders Quadrant, reflecting the company’s recognition for both "Ability to Execute" and "Completeness of Vision."

headline: Atrium Surpasses $1 Billion Customer ROI Goal, Driven by Industry-Leading AI-Assisted Delivery
summary: Atrium, the only AI-native Salesforce and Snowflake consulting partner, today announced it has officially surpassed $1 billion in documented customer impact. This milestone, tracked via the consultancy's first-of-its-kind $1B Customer Impact Dashboard, represents the tangible financial outcomes—including increased revenue, improved retention, and operational efficiency—delivered to Atrium's clients through AI and data-driven transformation.

headline: Dan Ives Calls AI-Driven Software Selloff 'Most Disconnected Trade,' Says Salesforce And ServiceNow Are Historic Buys
summary: On Friday, Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said Wall Street is misreading the impact of artificial intelligence on enterprise software. AI Disruption Fears Spark Software Rout Speaking on CNBC's "Closing Bell," Ives said investors are pricing in an unrealistic scenario in which AI tools rapidly replace traditional software platforms. "The most disconnected trade I've ever seen in my career on Wall Street," Ives said, referring to the sharp pullback in large-cap software stocks. Don't Miss: The AI Marke

headline: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.

raw.headline: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
raw.summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.
